website_summaries.verdict: Despite its budget-friendly price, this serger is capable of handling complicated projects.
pros: High-quality construction from a leading name in the space, as it features a metal frame and reliable components
Color-coded thread guide on the dials helps beginners get their bearings with the machine
Instruction manual also comes with a helpful, step-by-step DVD
cons: Occasional reports of missing parts, including spool parts or oil

customer_reviews.title: Mine was a lemon
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after some research, what I had mot really noticed was the amount of lemons people get. Should have realized after the 2nd time I used it and the arm bar handle flew off that mine was a lemon. a plastic piece also fell out of the insides which is at the end of the presser foot up/down arm. Tenskon dials became loose( actual little bolts), causing constant timing issues once trying to stitch... Needless to say I am buying another brand.
customer_reviews.author: SD

customer_reviews.title: Comes threaded with color-coded thread to help you understand the setup
customer_reviews.text: I -just- unboxed it, haven't used it yet, but I really appreciate that they send it set up with color-coded thread and a pre-made chain to help you understand how it all works. Since this is said to be one of the hardest parts of serging I really appreciate this touch. Comes with an extra set of needles.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Bodt

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy, unless you like paying for repairs.
customer_reviews.text: I’m an intermediate level sewist. And I normally love brother machines; however, this serger is not very good. There are better sergers out there in there same price range. I’ve had to have this thing serviced so many times, that I could’ve bought one of the better (but more expensive) models instead. It can’t handle mid-weight seams, or tight gathering of light fabrics (broke when I was gathering satin). The owner of authorized brother dealership that services my machine says that she won’t sell Brother sergers in her shop, because they are so low quality and end up needing so many repairs.
customer_reviews.author: kt

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: Broke within 30m of usage. Thank god I was in Amazons return window. Tried to sew a jacket cuff with some mid to heavy ribbing and it jammed. Finally got the wheel to turn and the upper looper kept catching the lower looper. Then it stopped catching the left thread. Decided to spend the extra money and get the juki654. Shouldnt be a big deal to sew a pieces of elastic and I can see the repairs on this easily exceeding its cost after a few slip ups.
customer_reviews.author: Lcke

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, quick, powerful, light and compact!
customer_reviews.text: Great machine for a great price! Never used a serger before and this was good for a beginner like me. It comes with ate by step instructions on how to thread and it is well diagramed and color coordinated. It’s is very powerful and quick. It can cut through two layers of fleece. The stitches are nice and tight. Easy to clean. Quickly sews with lightning speed to save time! Professional quality. It’s light and compact so it’s perfect for small spaces. I would encourage this as an intro machine if you are just learning to sew. The price is pretty affordable. The customer service it quick to respond to and questions. I’d buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: M.B.

customer_reviews.title: It has arrived broken making a horrible sound in the thread box
customer_reviews.text: I have used my machine only twice since delivery. It has arrived broken making a horrible sound in the thread box. It has been oiled where the instructions suggest, Which I thought was the problem not receiving a faulty machine. Oiled made no difference, still makes this sound which is not normal for this type of machine. Attached is a video. Very disappointed and a big waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Gruen

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Just make sure you Clean lint often.
customer_reviews.text: I do recommend changing the needles if your sewing cotton or knits. The needles it came with were too large more for thick fabrics. Lint can come from fabrics that are being trimmed while serger is running, frequent cleaning ex: small brush or vacuum handy for internal cleaning is recommended. Also their is two areas that need to be oiled often. Read your manual. Threading was super easy! Can't believe I stressed over not getting a serger years ago from reading or watching tutorials of people making it sound so frustrating. Not with this sweet machine..I think a kid could follow the instructions and do it👍😉🤗this sure saves me time and I love sewing more than ever now.
customer_reviews.author: Live_Love_Laugh

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need
customer_reviews.text: Been using this machine for several months. I agree it does need to be oiled first before using, but after using it several times I've noticed it doesn't make that awful crunching sound anymore. It's easy to use and thread if you are someone who is used to using sergers. I managed to use the narrow edge hem and wow! I never knew I could do that with a machine! It's so pretty! I previously had an expensive Viking that parts was discontinued and I couldn't get it to do serges and good as this machine! Well worth the money! Great value!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: I started to sew and was a half hour into my project when the machine smelled like it was burning and then it would not work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this serger a few months the before I needed to use it for Christmas. I started to sew and was a half hour into my project when the machine smelled like it was burning and then it would not work. I took it to a sewing machine repair shop and they told me the engine in the machine would have to be replaced - it burned out. I called fabric.com and they were very polite but could not help me. They said I would have to talk to the manufacturer. What a pain this is just 6 weeks before Christmas. I would never recommend this machine and i am sorry Amazon sells it.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey M. Sprague

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointment!
customer_reviews.text: I had this serger years ago and loved it. Went to a Janome and then decided to go back to this one. What a disappointment! It’s quality has plummeted. Have to sew rolled hems slowly or the thread breaks, it just randomly comes unthreaded, rattles all over the place as you sew. Too late to return, of course. Update - Just made a big thump and stopped cold. Won’t move. Totally useless and I’ve used it about four times.
customer_reviews.author: Do-Over

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed, broke in a week!
customer_reviews.text: Machine broke within a WEEK... so unimpressed. There is a little 2 pronged piece near the stitch finger that will break. Brother will tell you to take it to get serviced even though they have redesigned the needle plate to avoid the little piece breaking. Brother customer service claims no responsibility for their product. Disappointed. There is a Facebook group called "Brother 1034d serger tips." Very helpful. Thankfully Amazon is great about product returns!
customer_reviews.author: v_maxine

customer_reviews.title: Not All It's Cracked Up to Be
customer_reviews.text: I have had this serger for 4 years and it's had pretty light use. The upper looper will no longer catch the left needle thread. I did ALL the things to try and resolve it but the issue is that the upper looper arm no longer swings far enough left. The timing is off. It costs $150 minimum to take the machine in for repair. Do yourself a favor and spend a little more on a Juki or comparable and get something a little more durable.
customer_reviews.author: April Winn Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic machine
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this machine as my go to machine (Janome) is in transit from the UK as we've just moved, however I needed to sew and I thought I'd take a try at the brother! It's a lovely machine, quiet compared to the janome and has way more extras in comparison. The price is fantastic an absolute bargain. Easy to use and easy to thread, it comes Pre threaded with colour threads I highly recommend buying a set of 4 threads for its arrival as I personally didn't want to sew with multi colour threads red/green/blue/yellow colour coded to threading the machine. I've added a picture of the baby clothes I made on the machine. Thank you Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Laura Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Customer Service for Poorly Manufactured Machine
customer_reviews.text: Customer service at Brother is absolutely horrible. My machine was used briefly and lost functionally of presser foot lever almost immediately. Poor design and cheap components. I will never purchase another Brother product. Customer service told me after emailing about my concerns and issues to contact the closest service team to have machcie looked over. However provided NO information as to where that service provider would be. Leaving additional work to me, the consumer, who has received poor equipment. Don’t waste your money on this model or brand, my next serger will certainly not be Brother.
customer_reviews.author: Paige Emmrich

customer_reviews.title: OIL BEFORE USE!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great machine for people who are just sewing for personal use. It is not heavy duty so it doesn't take a beating. Not intended for large volume like selling on etsy. Just a heads up. Buy something more industrial. I have had a few issues with it in the first year of having it but I am using it on a daily basis. PLEASE OIL WHEN YOU GET IT! It says this in the manual but many dont read it. very important or you will have issues right away.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Button

customer_reviews.title: Great for starting out
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it had great reviews and was in need of a serger. I had never used a serger before and I’m so happy I bought this one. It has guidelines to help with threading the serger. They are really easy to follow. I also received two books, one being a manual, on how to use the serger and the different designs you can do. It is so easy to follow! Great for me being a beginner. It came with tools for cleaning and such. I really enjoy my serger!
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use as a beginner!  Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Bought based only on reviews, so far so good! Was easily able to thread from watching online videos. The CD that comes with machine is outdated and not helpful for setting tension (and who can play a CD now anyway?) - Obviously videos from the 90's. But nonetheless I was able to set it up, thread it successfully the first time and it's so foolproof that setting all the tensions at about 5 produced a totally functional seam. I made 2 pairs of PJ pants for my daughters in a flash. As a disclaimer I am almost 40 and very proficient at a regular sewing machine, but a total novice at the serger. Highly recommend, it's been super fun.
customer_reviews.author: E. Chen

customer_reviews.title: This changes everything!
customer_reviews.text: It works and works beautifully! Have waited forever to purchase a serger, intimidated by the issues with threading, and running into timing problems but it was not even hard. Threading it was NOT bad at all. I threaded it slowly following a youtube video, and this machine was sewing gorgeous, professional finished seems right after. This changes everything! Can't wait to sew up some more knit projects. I purchased this machine from Amazons Warehouse, thank you to whoever returned this item because it rocks and works brilliantly and I got a lovely deal!
customer_reviews.author: Amazoncustomer

customer_reviews.title: Great serger
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure if I needed a serger but now that I have one, I am so glad I took the plunge! I was terrified to thread it, but I found a video that was super helpful and it's really not that hard to thread. Beware of pins...I got a little too close to the knife with a pin and snapped the upper knife in half. This is a very reasonably priced machine and works great. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: A RovettoTop Contributor: Fashion Design

customer_reviews.title: Threading order is important!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid little workhorse that is great for beginners. It is a pain to thread but that is common with any cheap machine. Also very noisy but even my fancy babylock sewing machine sounds like a machine gun when I run it at full speed lol. Just make sure you thread the machine in the proper order!! Otherwise it won't work!! That really should be in bold in a big red note in the manual. Luckily the ladies at my local quilting shop know sergers well and were able to get me set straight on that. I actually wrote the order right on the machine since it absolutely doesn't follow a logical order (4,3,1,2).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I AM KING OF TAPERED SHIRTS MUTTERFUNKER!
customer_reviews.text: I don't sew, but I knew what a surger was. After losing 25 pounds, I needed to take in my "tents", otherwise known as dress shirts. Hell, I did my T-shirts too. I did everything. My Hawaiian shirts. My out-of-style jeans that were wide as stove pipes are now skinny jeans. One youtube vid. Suddenly I'm a seamstress.
customer_reviews.author: Neeks

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE this machine. I use it daily!
customer_reviews.text: Second Time purchasing this model. First time I was impatient and didn’t read the manual. There is a YouTube series that is basically a step by step users manual via videos. I watched every one and know exactly what is wrong when something seems a little off. Only thing I would recommend is taping down the tension dials. I don’t have a bouncy table at all and they seem to move from 4 (recommended tension) to 6 -8 without even realizing. I just taped down all the dials and when I need to re-thread I just remove the tape. Works great. Love this machine
customer_reviews.author: Cory Froling

customer_reviews.title: Great serger for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Love this serger! It was recommended by a Joanne employee. And what a great recommendation! I pretty much was able to operate it straight out of the box. I did get on YouTube for additional information. I've never used a server. Never thought I needed one. Good grief I've been sewing since Home Ec 50 yrs ago. I certainly have managed. However this serger has changed my sewing. I feel it's more finished. And using a serger for knits which I never felt comfortable with on a regular machine. For Christmas gifts I made knit PJ's for my grandma's and every piece was on the serger. Yup! A great great purchase! Great price point! Great addition to your sewing room!
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: I could have bought a better quality one
customer_reviews.text: I've had to have this serger repaired three times for going over more than 3 layers (any hem, really) of fabric. I'm careful, I follow all the rules of serging, and it still gets knocked out of alignment. For the price I paid for this cheaper serger + the multiple repairs, I could have bought a better quality one. And I did recently after being so fed up with this one. My new one hasn't broken down once and this one now sits in a corner to think about what it did.
customer_reviews.author: Lara

customer_reviews.title: So far so great!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this about a week and have used it several times. It’s my first serger and I was intimidated, but it’s very easy to use. I watched a video tutorial playlist by Sewing Mastery ahead of time and the whole thing was a cinch. My aim isn’t the best yet so sometimes things come out uneven but I’m sure that’ll get better with time. The quality of the machine seems really good, it’s very easy to thread—VERY easy to thread compared to my expectations, and hasn’t had any hiccups. You can disengage the knife too which is helpful. Overall I’m very happy with the machine, and very glad I got it before the price went up.
customer_reviews.author: K. D.

customer_reviews.title: Still working well after 3.5 years
customer_reviews.text: This has been used almost daily since the purchase 3.5 years ago, for our small business. Sometimes we serge only 1 or 2 things per day, and other times it may be 60. The serger has had it's issues with the threads jamming and breaking, which was sometimes user error, sometimes not. This is a general rule, but practice getting your tensions correct with scrap fabric (of the same type you'll be using) BEFORE you work on actual projects. Also, the insides get VERY dusty, so clean it often. I'd say that it was a good purchase overall.
customer_reviews.author: sean b.

customer_reviews.title: Works well, good for beginner
customer_reviews.text: I have had good luck so far. I was intimidated by changing the thread the first time, but I think that's true with all the machines. I recommend going through the manual and labeling each spool and each button right on the machine. You'll want that written on there while you're getting used to the terminology. As others warned, I bought sewing machine oil so I could oil it before use and haven't had any problems yet. Worth it for just getting into serging.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Serger
customer_reviews.text: When you are trimming off narrow strips of fabric it can go into the mechanism instead of staying outside of the body and into the front catch basin. The pre-set tensions don't match the directions, and you will receive two sets of paper information for the various stitches with occasionally conflicting settings. Always check the serger stitches on a scrap fabric prior to serging your project and adjust the tension or stitches as necessary. The instruction booklets are very confusing to follow. I used my old serger a lot on cottons, fleece, and various fabric weights; this serger doesn't seem to be as good as my older basic Necchi serger.
customer_reviews.author: Teardrop Camper

customer_reviews.title: BROKEN WHEN RECIEVED AND NO REFUND
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!!!!! The 1st time I went to use this product, it did not work. Unfortunately, it was A month and a 1/2 after my purchase. Because of this Amazon would not take the return. I contacted brother and they said that I would have to send it to an authorized service representative. There are no service representatives in a 150 mile radius of where I live. Therefore, I RECIEVED A BROKEN PRODUCT AND COULD NOT GET IT SERVICED OR MY MONEY BACK.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful machine.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to thread and sew. I keep it in a wooden crate with handles and can carry it from storage to the sunniest room in the house for sewing. There is a bit of a learning curve for someone who has only used an antique sewing machine, but I enjoyed learning how to blind hem stretchy fabrics and create fun projects from t-shirts.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: click here
customer_reviews.text: I caught on fairly quickly but i feel it may give others a small issue which is not a big problem because it’s something new that you’re learning. I didn’t have the machine long before I had to take it to the shop and get a minor part fixed, I was taught that these are one of the cheaper models of sergers which shocked me because it wasn’t cheap but other ones are 500+ so I see what they were talking about
customer_reviews.author: Nicole White

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife and she loves it! Very versatile and well built serger for the price. Has many features. Comes with instructional CDs produced primarily for Windows, however there are mpg's for each segment that will play on a Mac (if you have one old enough to have a CD drive). Might make more sense to just make a DVD! The better option is to go to You Tube and the entire instructional video is there along with others users have made. This machine could be a one stop shop for many users!
customer_reviews.author: James S. Sloan

customer_reviews.title: Many issues, broken parts with use.
customer_reviews.text: This machine was my first serger. I have had it two years. It was easy to learn how to use, but I have been disappointed with its quality. The light has gone out, it jams, it has had start/stalling issues I have had to troubleshoot, and now the bottom tooth feeder has completely broken. It was jamming my project again and I took a look to see the METAL had completely broken at the site it lowers and raises from. I will be buying a higher quality machine next. For future buyers, know this is an okay machine to learn on. Just don’t expect your money to go very far.
customer_reviews.author: EmEV

customer_reviews.title: Warrenty work i'snt free. Broke after 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: Broke after using 3 times. 3 months old. Brother service center wants $108 to clean oil and adjust before they will honor warrenty. What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: ASTON

customer_reviews.title: Defective product and no warranty support
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this serger three months ago. I used it occasionally then it suddenly stopped working. It seems to be a problem with the foot pedal. I've attempted to contact Brother but have been unable to speak with anyone. Initially I called the number listed on the warranty. When you call that number, there's a recorded message that refers you to the Brother website, then it disconnects the call. When I call the number listed on the website for customer service, I get a message that all circuits are busy. I've tried to call numerous times. I also emailed the Brother but have not received a response. I will never buy another Brother product.
customer_reviews.author: Christy L. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Understandable, reliable and puts out great results!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great serger! It has so many features and was easy to understand. My wife does most of the sewing and crafts but this one was easy enough to learn for me (not very experienced). I wish we had gotten this earlier! It's a solid construction and we have not experienced any jamming or any other issues for that matter. So, all-in-all, exactly what we were hoping for!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Machine being donated to charity, life is too short..
customer_reviews.text: I spent hours threading and re-threading to get a finished looking hem. Then the thread broke and I re-threaded and the tension settings all had to be changed. I photographed the settings the first time I got it to work, but the settings would not work after I re-threaded it. Then I photographed those settings, but the third time neither of the two first settings worked. The machine is going to charity, maybe someone else can get it to work..
customer_reviews.author: Gardenandknit

customer_reviews.title: I think it was a counterfeit/knock off machine
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sure I received a knock off version. The box the machine came in had broken English and didn’t look like brother logo or packaging. Machine smelled like toxic plastic upon in-boxing. Manual was in broken English. When I plugged in and tried to use it, machine engine would make noise but needles wouldn’t move until pedal was pushed almost all the way down. Motor made rusty sounds when being operated. Felt cheap. Sounded bad. Didn’t feel like it would last. Didn’t look or sound like the 1034D’s I’ve seen on YouTube. It went back.
customer_reviews.author: leah wolk

customer_reviews.title: I have to look up how to thread it every time, otherwise great!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't looking to break the bank when I decided to add a serger to my sewing room, so I settled on the Brother 1034D. This machine has completely changed how I construct everything, and I feel much more comfortable sewing with knits now. I've been really pleased with how well it works and how easy it it to use (aside from the fact that I have to google how to thread it every. single. time). Overall I would definitely recommend this machine, particularly for someone who isn't sure whether they really want or need a serger.
customer_reviews.author: VStevens

customer_reviews.title: If I can do it you can do it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Yessssss! I'm in no way a pro seamstress,but dabble I do! With great zeal I might add! I was super freaked out about sergers and not that knowledgable so I did some research and price checking like any normal person would, and this serger fit the bill quality was there, did everything I was lookin for and more.. Which now I'm confident to try!!!! So awesome,not overly complicated and everything I have tried AWESOME! Now gotta go my serger is calling! My advice is go for it! This one is great and not overly complicated!!
customer_reviews.author: Jaci Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Extremely pleased with my new serger!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a sewer for over 65 years but this is my first serger and I am extremely pleased with it. I was able to understand it and use it immediately. I did not want the cheapest nor the most expensive because I just wanted to use it for my personal sewing projects. It is exactly what I wanted and expected. I am VERY happy with my serger!!!!!!!! I would definitely recommend it to any sewer for his or her personal sewing projects. I do not sew for a profession, only as a personal hobby/craft.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Camp

customer_reviews.title: Good machine for beginners and advanced level
customer_reviews.text: I am a sewing professional- I bought this serger for at home and for students (I am teaching too). i am very satisfied- it comes already threaded so you dont have to spend time with instructions and threading. For me it's easy to use since I have a lot of sewing experience but I think it's a good choice for beginners too. The only thing Iam not 100% satisfied is the noise (it's a bit loud) but I guess for that price it's still ok. The seam is perfect no matter which fabric I use or how many layers. Don't have to adjust tension all the time. Thank you for a good and cheap product :)
customer_reviews.author: Berryann

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't come with the large thread spools pictured
customer_reviews.text: I bought this but didn't buy the large spools because it doesn't say thread not included. All photos - even on the box, show the large spools, but you only get small spools of thread. Not happy. Update: Amazon was of zero help. I tried calling Brother customer support at 2 phone numbers and waited 35 minutes and 42 minutes on the phone with no one answering my call.
customer_reviews.author: Joan S.

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: The main problem is that the entire point of a serger is that it cuts the excess fabric as it binds and sews. This machine does not. It was either defective or something else is wrong. I've had it in to a professional who looked and said its set up to cut but there does not appear to be the piece attached that does it. There was no link to return or exchange it and the manufacturer has not returned or responded to any messages concerning their machine.
customer_reviews.author: Shauna Steele/AU Dance

customer_reviews.title: 3 serger in 4 months?!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously wanted to love this. It is an overclock, does what I need (in theory) I am about to ship back my 2nd serger for a 3rd replacement. Luckily amazon is super helpful. I called brother they wanted me to drive it 2.5 hours one way to have it looked at or pay the shipping to send it to them. I DONT CHARGE OR PAY SHIPPING, it is 2019. The 1st time, it totally seized and they they couldn't trouble shoot, the second time the knife wouldn't engage also they couldn't troubleshoot. Die to the fact that I got it on super sale, I will try one mor replacement before I totally switch brands. Unfortunate.
customer_reviews.author: hannah bowen

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed Purchaser
customer_reviews.text: I am somewhat disappointed, it is very loud, not a smooth operation and gets stuck when pressing the foot pedal trying to sew. I have to manually turn the wheel to get it going. If it wasn't a urgent need for it I would have returned it. Not a good choice for the money spent. I will be buying another one from a singer store. This will be my backup if needed or put in a yard sale.
customer_reviews.author: Vernice Carson

customer_reviews.title: It worked beautifully for a couple weeks
customer_reviews.text: It worked beautifully for a couple weeks. The needle plate broke and the timing fell out within a month. I payed a local shop $85 to service it. They said these machines have a lot of problems. Told me to try and return it. I can't so i'm stuck with this money pit that even after the service isn't working well. Extremely unhappy with this product. I should have saved my money and got a better serger.
customer_reviews.author: J e

customer_reviews.title: Fave
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine, had it a year now and it is still going strong. Following the cleaning instructions in the manual helps a bit, and there are videos out there galore for this machine as it is established and still used as a good starter serger. Small con- it is so loud when using. Much louder than some of the competitors that start with a J. It doesn't bother me too much, however I wouldn't want to use if someone were sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: Annigirl22

customer_reviews.title: It started out working fine. Now it's not quite working the way it ...
customer_reviews.text: Not very thrilled with this purchase. I bought this as my first serger about a month ago. It started out working fine. Now it's not quite working the way it should be. Threading the machine is a nightmare. I follow all the steps in the manual, in order. The lower looper keeps unthreading. Not worth it. I advise saving up to invest in a higher quality machine.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Check out the negative reviews before you buy
customer_reviews.text: Returned after 1 use. While serging edges on cotton material the stitches started skipping then the machine stopped chaining. This was a replacement for my baby lock that I have had for 13 years. I read the manual, checked tension, threading, needles, and no luck. Machine would not chain. After looking online, it seems multiple people have had the same issue. According to other users it is a timing issue. Returning and purchasing another baby lock
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sewing with stretch fabrics is easy now, and I wish I had purchased a ...
customer_reviews.text: This machine changed my life! Sewing with stretch fabrics is easy now, and I wish I had purchased a Serger 5 years ago, absolutely essential for anyone who sews. Also I have had no problems with this little machine so far after 6+ months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Cordelia

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. Won’t thread
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely horrible machine. Lower looper never stays threaded, breaks every 20 stitches. No, I’m not threading it wrong I’ve watched every video and tried every solution. This machine is cheap and it doesn’t work. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: honestly honest

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly simple to use!
customer_reviews.text: My, how Sergers have changed since the last one I bought in 1990-something! This baby is so easy to thread, and setting the tension is a snap. I make a lot of baby clothes and love the speed and efficiency. Also, it uses regular sized needles! My old serger was a Pfaff and I had such a hard time finding the correct needles for it. It comes with a dvd that shows you all sorts of wonderful things you can do, besides just seams. I highly recommend this serger, even for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Lura K

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst machine I have ever purchased. It broke within the first 3 months of use. I could not get a refund. The company ought to shame selling machines of this quality. I never write reviews but I wanted to share what others are experiencing...you truly get what you pay for...a short lived machine..
customer_reviews.author: Audrey T

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself the favor!
customer_reviews.text: Once you get past the learning curve of threading it’s sooooo amazing. There is a super helpful video I found online by burley sew that makes it super easy to thread. I still reference the video to thread, I think it’ll take a handful of times until getting the hang of it. I’ve never been so excited to sew with clean seams. I’ve spent more money on fabric in the last couple weeks, my husband isn’t overly excited about it but I can’t stop!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: It’s just OK
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a new serger since mine is over 30 years old. I looked at the reviews and decided for the price I’d try this one. Oiled it out of the box and fired it up! Put it back in the box and returned it! It was very loud and grindy sounding. My 30 yr old one was quieter. I’ll save more money and buy. Better machine!
customer_reviews.author: nenimlasj

customer_reviews.title: Was sewing fine for about 3 months than started grinding and needles ...
customer_reviews.text: So when received the cut blade was broken instead of returning it ordered new blade. Was sewing fine for about 3 months than started grinding and needles kept breaking. Brother said to take to shop, well it will cost more to fix than paid for..
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: I loved it! Except a screw fell out after the first couple of uses...
customer_reviews.text: And I haven't been able to find a replacement that fits. It's the screw that holds the needles in place so that's pretty important. Otherwise, it's a great machine! As with pretty much any serger (especially if you don't have much experience with one), it's a nightmare to rethread. I don't recommend it as a first machine for any sewer mostly because of how complicated it can be and how little room for error there is while using a serger.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SO EASY TO THREAD...AND USE.  LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had a Kenmore serger for 30 years, I purchased this Brother serger when it was time to replace the Kenmore. I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE THIS MACHINE!!! This serger is SO easy to thread and a great value. I had NO issues in receiving it on time. I would order from this seller again with NO reservations. Thanks Brother for making such a user friendly machine.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my mom. She has many years experience with use of sewing and serger equipment in both her professional career and home sewing needs. She was quite pleased with the price, features and ease of use of this device. At 88 years of age, threading the Brother Serger, 1034D was pretty easy for her.
customer_reviews.author: Tony T

customer_reviews.title: It's a great for the price but if you need a good free arm you may want to spend more.
customer_reviews.text: I love the whole machine, it works really well. I haven't gone further that a standard 4 thread serger stitch but that's all I need for now. The only thing I don't like is that the free arm doesn't work for what I need it for, so its creating some complications. I can't put my material all the way under the needle to sew my sleeve straight There is a part of the machines base that is in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Amy S.

customer_reviews.title: ... bought this machine in the hopes to have an amazing sewing experience
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine in the hopes to have an amazing sewing experience. I have tried everything possible to get the tension to be tight like its supposed to be and it is very loose no matter what i do. I am hopping to get a replacement machine. i am now over the return policy but I am hoping to get a new machine where the tension works the way it should.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love my serger. Works great very excited!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine. Been wanting a serger for years. I am so excited. Perfect machine. Plan on buying extra thread. This only comes with very small spools of thread doesnt last very long. But I didnt mind I had pre planned for that. The threading of the different threads was a little confusing at first but if u check out the diagram and the book together. It finally makes sense. Trial and error. Got it..!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dud!
customer_reviews.text: I must have got the dud that everyone is complaining about. The handwheel was broken, and the machine would not crank up. It sounded like it wanted to do something. Stepped on the pedal and it sounded like the motor was working overtime. The needles wouldn't move at all. Very surprising because I have a Brother CE 1100PRW (my first sewing machine) which works great and a Brother 2340CV (which also works). I was tempted to reorder, but I don't think I will chance it. Looks like I will be purchasing the Juki MO644D Portable Serger with similar features, but with less negative reviews than the Brother.
customer_reviews.author: Shaleena Osuji

customer_reviews.title: Almost better than my actual sewing machine!
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. I was in the middle of a linen project and this just made everything so much easier. It came already threaded and color coated so it’s easier to thread when you run out. I sealed all my seams in a dress I’m making and everything came out so clean and fray free. I even used it to gather and hand gather. While it does offer a gathering feature, if you prefer hand gathering it makes it so much easier. Just pull the red thread and watch it get the prettiest gathers. It is worth every penny and probably more. I’m so excited to see what else I can do with it!
customer_reviews.author: Addie

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to learn
customer_reviews.text: I had done some research before getting a serger. This is absolutely as easy to learn as the reviews I read say it is. Video online is for the model previous but is easy to follow and very detailed. Machine works well, doesn’t take up much space.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Brother serger WOW!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this machine. I did a lot of research for a easy serger for a beginner. I am a new at sewing and my sister has a very expensive serger, and wanted me to buy a baby loc, she was really impressed with this. It is quiet, sews beautifull saves lots of time and gives a professional finish. Very easy to thread, Utube was a great help. This little Machine will gather fabric also. You won't go wrong with buying this and the price is right!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Oh my goodness I really love this serger
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness I really love this serger. This is my first serger and I was really nervous to use it. I was certain I would mess it up or not be able to figure out how to thread it but I read the manual and after watching a few YouTube clips on how to thread it up it really wasn't hard at all. The directions on the actual machine make it very straight forward. Ive had a lot of fun using this for different projects and would recommend this serger for any one wanting to add a more professional/durable finish to their projects.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: I really have no idea what this thing really does but my wife loves it. She has about 12 different sewing machines from a singer bought at wm to a 36” . She knows what she’s doing and she loves this thing for whatever it does. She did show me what it does ( makes heavy stitches for jean hems ? Or edges on material projects ?) and I’m not too sure, but it makes her smile and git off my case so it was a great purchase when I saw it on amazon deals.
customer_reviews.author: donkey-boy

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected!
customer_reviews.text: Not at all what I expected. So very disappointed. I wish I had ordered the comparable Juki model. I’ll never make this mistake again.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Banda

customer_reviews.title: Good machine
customer_reviews.text: First, I love that it came pre threaded with four different colored threads. That made it easy to start using immediately. As a newbie it was nice to use the colors to figure out which thread came from where. The users manual is very easy to understand. This is my favorite purchase of the year and I am LOVING owning a serger to bring my clothes making to life.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail

customer_reviews.title: Great Smaller Overlock for Home Sewing
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I purchased this brother overlock. It's super simple and color coded for easy threading. I've been using it for almost a year and have had no problems with it. I needed a smaller one than the one I had because I can't keep my machines set up in my place. This one is more lightweight than a lot of others and easily set up so I spend more time sewing than setting up. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Too bad they don't have a note on the top of ...
customer_reviews.text: This machine was almost ready to go right out of the box. However, if you don't read the manual all the way to the end, you would not know that you are supposed to oil it before you start using it. Too bad they don't have a note on the top of the machine that you would see before you use it. Fortunately I'm one of those people who actually read the manual even though I've had a serger before. It works great. A little noisy but very tolerable. Color coding makes it easy to thread.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to do a good job. Happy with the purchase. It comes threaded, but the supplied spools are small and run out quickly. I recommend that you go ahead and order larger cones to keep you going.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome so far!
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to better sew seams for pillows and other miscellaneous craft items. It works VERY well and fast! Threading it takes some getting used to but it comes with color coded test thread that really helps. It takes a lot of getting used to the first few times. It’s a little intimidating with the cutters, dual needles and how fast it goes. Just take your time. My biggest suggestion is to watch some YouTube videos to help get the hang of it. The instructions are a bit hard to understand at first. Just go slow and take your time. Don’t get discouraged.
customer_reviews.author: EGReviewsTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Its simply the best!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little workhorse! It can do almost anything I throw at it (except double sided sequins but let's be real that's for a production level machine). I've actually purchased two of these, one for me and one as a gift for my aspiring seamstress sister for Christmas. And anyone who has approached me for advice I always tell them this model. It's an awesome basic domestic machine and has been my saving grace for stretchy Lyra projects.
customer_reviews.author: Lynzie Marie

customer_reviews.title: User friendly
customer_reviews.text: I have always been intimidated by sergers. after receiving this machine and watching about 25 different videos on you tube I am using it with ease. The only reason I gave it a 4 star rating is the light bulb blew out already!
customer_reviews.author: PAbird

customer_reviews.title: Great serger
customer_reviews.text: I've had two other sergers, an older Bernette and an older Brother 920D. I loved the 920D because it was SO easy to thread but when it started wearing out I purchased this newer Brother. So far I have had NO issues. I love this machine, it's the same easy way to thread as my older brother but with newer features. I'm very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: R. ODonnell

customer_reviews.title: Love this workhorse and it will love you back!
customer_reviews.text: Toughest part is threading, which is very clear on the videos provided online, as well as other useful tutorials. I've sewed through sequined fabric (with the cutter lowered), multiple layers of fleece, cotton and stretchy synthetics. No problems. Keep it dusted and don't horse around with high speeds on bulky fabrics, or pull your needle while stitching. Love this machine!
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Nims

customer_reviews.title: Bad design? This was worse on the replacement i was sent.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it is just mine or not but the spot where the top knife meets with the fold down door is a small gap and fabric that the knife cuts goes down in it into the working parts of the machine. I have to stop every few runs of it and clean it out. Not good if you want to make something quick.
customer_reviews.author: AHay

customer_reviews.title: Best beginner machine IMO
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine and the fact that there are a ton of you tube videos in how to use this machine I was sold on it being my first serger. No issues with anything. I LOVE this product although I had never worked before on a serger and I was intimidated... at first, but with online instruction, plus the manual and easy to follow directions, I had no problems. I have made my son's play army fatigues (he's 7 he wears them all the time), finished 2 dresses (for me), my daughter's pajamas. This was my best birthday present I have ever gotten.
customer_reviews.author: Jewels C.

customer_reviews.title: Brother CS6000i
customer_reviews.text: Junk, just started using this machine and already not working. I even had someone look at it and was told the machine has issues and will cost more then it's worth to fix. Turns me off from sewing all together!
customer_reviews.author: Michele Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Don't be afraid of sergers - this is a good one and easy to thread and use
customer_reviews.text: This is my first serger and I love it. I oiled it as per the user manual before my first use. Threading is not difficult at all. It comes with a CD that has a video of how to thread it, the user manual has good instructions on how to thread it, and the machine itself has diagrams on it when you open the access door of how to thread it. I took a serger class at my local sewing shop and learned how to adjust tension and do different types of seams and stitches like a rolled edge. Don't fear the serger! It's a wonderful machine to add to your sewing room.
customer_reviews.author: Seven Stars

customer_reviews.title: Used right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I watched a couple of videos, The most intimidating thing about this machine is threading it. I clipped the threads that came on the machine. Tied on my serger thread and stitched on scrap fabric until the threads I tied on stitched. Easiest way I found to thread machine!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to thread and use and a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it. I had a singer server for 25 years. Replaced it with a professional singer 5 years ago. Which was a nightmare to thread and expensive. I bought this brother after looking at reviews and videos. In five minutes I had it set up and running. I have changed the thread several times and it’s super simple and fast. It’s like Brother asked all the serger users what they love and hate about sergers and then designed one with all the loved features and none of the hate. I wish I had bought it sooner! You will love this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great machine for home projects or small business
customer_reviews.text: It works really well except the light didn't work after a few weeks of using it! This is the second machine that I bought and both had issue with the light!! Otherwise, great machine for home projects or small business!
customer_reviews.author: sonary

customer_reviews.title: Hard to thread
customer_reviews.text: I have had a difficult time learning to thread my machine. There is no one nearby to take the machine to for help. I consulted the videos on you tube but the lighting isn’t bright enough. I still don’t have it.
customer_reviews.author: sugarmag424

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely essential for sewing seams
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after doing a sewing project and discovered how enjoyable sewing clothes can be. It is indispensable for sewing seams that won't fray when you wash them. There are also quite a few decorative stitches it can so, which I want to explore as time permits. All in all, I think it's a good deal compared to other machines costing many times more.
customer_reviews.author: JustMe

customer_reviews.title: 2 broken machines in a row!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these and had to return both. The first one didn't work right out of the box. The second one worked for about a day and then stopped. The needles were not clearing each other on either machine. I am without a serger for the moment and will look into other brands. :( Amazon was great about the replacing and then the refund.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie S. Sulzman

customer_reviews.title: Broken in Box
customer_reviews.text: This arrived a while ago but I just opened it today. Inside the box, all of the pieces were all over the place, and upon threading and attempting to use the machine, the timing was totally off and it doesn’t work at all. Paper weight. I’ve been using one of these machines for years and I’m super disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Barber

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I’m a beginner sewer and it’s pretty easy to use. The colour coded threading guides help a lot. The only thing keeping me from giving it a full 5 stars is that the light casts a shadow over the little metal pieces making it slightly difficult to thread in that area especially since I have poor vision. But other than that this machine gets the job done and it’s pretty inexpensive. Definitely would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Good beginning machine
customer_reviews.text: A great beginner serger! I am a costume design student, and this is the machine that we use in our classroom. I decided that I would like a machine in my home, and I fell in love with the ease of use of this machine in the classroom. At such a good price, I purchased immediately, and have been using for two months now, with no problems whatsoever. As many other comments, the machine does not come preoiled, and you will have to oil it yourself. Instructions are on page 57 of the manual.
customer_reviews.author: Coral

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love
customer_reviews.text: Love, Love, Love it!!! This my 3rd serger, the first was a Babylock that I loved and wore out. The second never sewed right and was frustrating to work with. I was in dire need of a new serger that made sewing fun again (I'm making grandbabies Halloween costumes). I checked out the reviews and decided on this one. I received it yesterday, read the booklet and practiced with it. Threaded it today and started sewing, it sews beautifully (I'm working with stretch knits). It's probably the easiest serger I had to thread too. NOTE: All sergers are more intricate to thread than regular sewing machines, but just follow the booklet and start sewing. Very Happy!
customer_reviews.author: Samw

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginners
customer_reviews.text: OBSESSED with this serger! I taught myself how to sew 3 months ago & was able to watch 20 minutes of videos to figure this guy out. It’s making my projects sturdy and secure & I feel confident in my work! It’s also surprising easy to thread. I’ve heard horror stories of threading sergers and I’ve been able to do it without fuss. I’ve only had a few weeks so can’t speak on its durability or longevity but we’re doing great so far at the low cost of $229!
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee Hoelck

customer_reviews.title: Not designed for Lefty's
customer_reviews.text: This serger had possibilities until it came down to the power cord, which is bundled with the foot control. This is problematic if you are left handed and are use to having the foot control on your left side to use in conjunction with your left foot. This machine is obviously designed for a right handed person. Because the cord is short, it cannot be easily reposition on the left side I am returning it for something that has a better design for left handed control/use.
customer_reviews.author: JerseyGirl

customer_reviews.title: The motor died after three years :(
customer_reviews.text: I loved it while it worked. I don’t sew every day but I used it once a week and it was good while it worked. Suddenly today it stopped working. Went to get it serviced and they told me the motor died. Three years is all I got out of it and that sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Irmalovesbrian

customer_reviews.title: Super easy for a newbie.
customer_reviews.text: I am new to serging and haven't had any lessons or instructions from anyone and I was able to watch a couple videos on threading the machine and sit right down and start serging. I have a made a few dresses so far with this serger and it works great. I liked mine so much, I just purchased a 2nd one for my friend.
customer_reviews.author: Cw

customer_reviews.title: Interesting piece of machinery
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a friend and she loves it. I guess that sergers have a bit of a learning curve but she said she had it up and running in no time and was practicing on some old fabric. I also bought the book "The Complete Serger Handbook" and she had said that was a great book to have as a new serger owner.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Burton

customer_reviews.title: great Mahone for new snd experienced sewers
customer_reviews.text: I have never used a serger and was hesitant to buy. It took me several weeks to unpack but it was worth the wait There is NO instruction CD. It has been discontinued but the site has some tips D YouTube is snaxing with plenty of tutorials with all the questions you have and more
customer_reviews.author: Luz

customer_reviews.title: I just opened it and attempted to turn it on ...
customer_reviews.text: I just opened it and attempted to turn it on and....nothing! There is a sound of a motor, but no movement. Very upset I was sold a nonworking machine.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Leland

product_meta.title: Brother 1034D Serger, Heavy-Duty Metal Frame Overlock Machine, 1,300 Stitches Per Minute, Removeable Trim Trap, 3 Included Accessory Feet
product_meta.description:
Style Name:1034DThe Brother 1034D serger features a 3/4 lay-in thread system with lower looper threader.Stitch options include 4 thread overlock 3 thread overlock narrow hem rolled hem and ribbon lock stitches.Additionally you can sew blind hem pin tuck and flat lock stitches by purchasing optional presser feet.The machine has a free arm/flat bed convertible sewing surface.The 1034D also offers a F.A.S.T. lower looper threading system for easy thread changes.The differential feed improves sewing results on stretch or thin fabrics to give you a perfect finish. Snap-on presser feet allow quick and easy changes to transition to each desired stitch.The 1034D also includes an instructional video tape to make serging fast easy and fun. This machine does not conform to International electronic codes. Warranty is voided outside the US.

AMAZON.COM


 BROTHER 1034D 3 OR 4 THREAD SERGER WITH EASY TO USE LAY IN THREADING, DIFFERENTIAL FEED, INSTRUCTIONAL DVD, BILINGUAL MANUAL, AND TOLL-FREE CUSTOMER SUPPORT 
Designed for finishing the edges and hems of a wide range of fabrics, including formal wear, linens and stretchy fabrics, and for creating ruffles and decorative edges, the Brother 1034D Serger is the perfect addition to any sewing room. This reliable, easy to learn and use 3 or 4 thread serger features 22 stitch functions, and snap-on, interchangeable creative feet. Stitch options include 4 thread overlock, 3 thread overlock, narrow hem, rolled hem, and ribbon lock stitches. With its differential fabric feed, the 1034D helps you achieve better stitch quality, for a more even, professional finish, even on very thin or stretchy fabrics. Threading is easy, with the color-coded upper thread guides and lower looper threading system. Plus, the included snap-on presser feet allow for quick and easy changes to transition to each desired stitch. To help you get started, the 1034D includes an instructional video, and a complete, printed instructional manual in English and Spanish. Backed with a 25-year limited warrantee, and free phone support for the life of the product.

 VERSATILE STITCH OPTIONS 
Choose from 4 thread overlock, 3 thread overlock, narrow hem, rolled hem, and ribbon lock stitches. 

EASY THREADING
The 1034D has easy to follow, color-coded lay-in threading, and the lower looper threading system is designed to make sure the thread stays right in place. 

DIFFERENTIAL FABRIC FEED FOR BETTER STITCH QUALITY
The differential fabric feed helps improve the stitch quality on virtually all types of fabric, especially important when sewing stretchy, knitted, or thin fabrics. Differential feed ratio is 0.7 to 2.0. 

FAST, UP TO 1300 STITCHES PER MINUTE
Saves time, and delivers high quality stitching, even at up to a high 1300 spm speed. 

 ADJUSTABLE STITCH WIDTH 
The stitch width can be easily adjusted between 5mm to 7mm from left needle, helping to provide the perfect stitch width for your project.

 REMOVABLE FREE ARM 
Simply slide off the removable arm to serge cylindrical items such as sleeves.

 USES STANDARD SEWING MACHINE NEEDLES 
No need to purchase special needles – the 1034D can use most standard home sewing machine needles. 

 PLUS, THESE OUTSTANDING FEATURES: 
• Bilingual operation manual and instructional CD:
The 1034D comes complete with an instructional video, and a printed, English and Spanish operation manual.
• Adjustable on/off knife feature:
The knife can be adjusted on or off by a simple lever operation. Useful for pintucking and flatlock. 
• Adjustable foot pressure:
The pressure of the presser foot is fully adjustable, to help ensure consistently highly quality stitching on both heavy and light fabrics. Loosening the pressure for lightweight materials will help prevent puckering, and will allow for easier sewing of curves.
• Removable stitch finger: 
Helps ensure consistently well-formed stitches along fabric edges.
• Brightly lit workspace:
No more task lights needed, as brilliant light floods the needle area.
• Optional feet available: 
Expand your options with additional Brother serger feet, available for additional purchase. For reinforced tape or elastic applications, be sure to use the optional Brother SA212 Serger Elastic Application Foot.
 IN THE BOX

Multi-purpose guide foot
Gathering foot
• Foot controller
• Accessory bag with needle set, 4 spool nets, tweezers, cleaning brush, hexl wrench, trim trap 
• Soft cover

 ABOUT BROTHER INTERNATIONAL CORPORATION 
Brother International Corporation has earned its reputation as a leading supplier of innovative products for home sewing and embroidery enthusiasts. The company is recognized for its high-quality, state-of-the-art machines and accessories, offering ease of use and flexibility at affordable prices. Brother is a wholly owned subsidiary of Brother Industries Ltd.
